title: Ticket #2950: Have a condor_submit mechanism for dealing with random seeds
description:
Miron suggested this in today's BMRB software meeting, when we were talking about CS-Rosetta...

Anyhow, he wants some kind of provision in condor_submit to get a random seed and stuff it into the classad for a job (rather than having the job itself look at /dev/random at startup or something like this). The intent of this is that, for example, if a vanilla universe got preempted and restarted, it would restart with the same random seed that it ran with the first time -- so that you'd truly be re-doing the same calculation as opposed to a different calculation. This would also serve as a record of the random seed used, that could be helpful for debugging.
